channel.title: Linux
channel.description:
Got a new error now,
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: java at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) Could not find the main class: java. Program will exit.

@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:389871”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=485782.msg3560123#msg3560123 date=1302205400]
Well i’m honestly not sure what ram is, i’m not that great with computers. But here we go. I have a 1 terabyte Hard-drive. And I have jdk and jre installed 100% I can run any other servers so i’m postitive. Idk wtf ANT is and i have tryed using eclipse its just too advanced for me, if someone can help me set that up. Just add me on msn and ill give teamviewer info

Msn: nicky_snowboardingmaster@hotmail.com

Thanks for helping
[/quote]

Nobody is going to spoonfeed you. And if you don’t know what RAM is, just leave. Now.[/quote]

Fuck yourself please? How about when you first fucking started bro. Get a FUCKING LIFE i’m not asking for spoon feeding,i’m trying to get my run.fucking bat to work… Look at any other threads in the help section and ask if their spoonfeeding cunt.

item.title: Linux
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

@protip: Use an IDE(Eclipse/Netbeans)

There is no, I repeat NO reason to run Java under wine.

In Ubuntu, type this command in the command prompt:

This will install the JDK and JRE.

sudo apt-get install openjdk-6-jdk

I would suggest writing your tasks using ant(becoming the standard). So this is what you would do in ant:

<project name="project name here" default="build">
    <!-- Declare some useful variables -->
    <property name="src.dir" value="src" />
    <property name="build.dir" value="build" />
    <property name="jar.file" value="${build.dir}/${ant.project.name}.jar" />

    <!-- Remove old compiled files -->
    <target name="clean">
        <delete dir="${build.dir}" />
        <mkdir dir="${build.dir}" />
    </target>

    <!-- Compile source -->
    <target name="build">
        <!-- if you don't set includeantruntime to false, it will generally complain-->
        <!-- also, you can remove the "listfiles=true" if you don't want to see all the files that were compiled -->
        <javac srcdir="${src.dir}" destdir="${build.dir}" includeantruntime="false" listfiles="true" />
    </target>
</project>

That’s just a little example on compiling your files. For other tasks(compiling, including different classes/libraries, etc) check out the ant documentation.

Now to run your server/whatever else via your Terminal/Console, all you have to do is this:

cd path/to/your/server/files
java package/name/to/Server

Note: You may have to include the -cp argument if you have other libraries(netty/mine, xstream, etc).

Read full topic
